intro: Aspidium otophorum, commonly known as the Mexican water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has fronds that are divided into smaller, lobed segments, giving it a delicate, lacy appearance. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Aspidium otophorum plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing shelter and food for various small organisms.
